definition: to take down from the shelves (e.g. a contaminated product)
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action
to support/frame/rack/framework/classifier for planes, large vehicles, radios etc

sentences.english: Authorities said hair dye containing lentine will be pulled off the shelves soon.
sentences.chinese: 相关人员表示，这些染发剂将很快下架。

sentences.english: Wan also said the company will not take the product off shelves or accept any returns.
sentences.chinese: 万玉华说，不会对产品进行下架或退货处理。

sentences.english: They were shipped all over the country but should be off store shelves by now.
sentences.chinese: 这些蜜瓜运抵全国各地，但目前应该都下架了。

sentences.english: Taobao will take the product off the shelves immediately, a manager said.
sentences.chinese: 淘宝网某经理表示将对该产品立即进行下架处理。

sentences.english: The next day, the tic-tac-toe game was pulled from stores.
sentences.chinese: 第二天，井字游戏从商店下架。

sentences.english: Instead, in an unpublicised recall, powder was withdrawn from shops.
sentences.chinese: 得到的结果却是非公开召回，奶粉在商店下架。

sentences.english: The government last week started emergency inspections to get contaminated goods off store shelves.
sentences.chinese: 政府上周开始紧急调查，将受污染产品下架。

sentences.english: The Russian authorities say any European vegetables already on sale in shops in Russia will be seized. Here's Foreign Ministry Spokesman Alexander Lukashevich.
sentences.chinese: 俄罗斯官员说，所有正在销售的欧洲蔬菜必须下架。

sentences.english: Millions of bottled drinks and tons of juice powder have already been pulled from the shelves.
sentences.chinese: 成千上万的瓶装饮料和大量的果汁粉已经被下架了。

sentences.english: Puma said it would pull the products off shelves and recall them.
sentences.chinese: 彪马方面称，他们将下架并召回问题产品。

sentences.english: Products without supporting documents will be pulled off shelves.
sentences.chinese: 没有证明文件的产品将被下架。

definition: to put goods on shelves/(of a product) to be available for sale
to return merchandise/to withdraw a product
(of a power plant, refinery etc) to shut down
to cease trading (temporarily or permanently)/to close down
to withdraw/to remove (from a place)/to remove from office

State Administration of Press, Publication, Radio, Film and Television (SAPPRFT), est. 2013 (abbr. for 國家新聞出版廣電總局|国家新闻出版广电总局[Guo2 jia1 Xin1 wen2 Chu1 ban3 Guang3 dian4 Zong3 ju2])/(prior to 2013) State Administration of Radio, Film, and Television (SARFT)
to cut the price/to drive down the price/to get cheaper
to order/to enjoin/to charge/to instruct sb to finish sth
